H'smith & City

Part closure

Saturday 23, Sunday 24 and Bank Holiday Monday 25 May, suspended between Edgware Road and Hammersmith and between Whitechapel and Barking. A rail replacement bus service operates between Hammersmith and Paddington.

Service A: between Hammersmith and Paddington, calling at Shepherds Bush, Latimer Road, Ladbroke Grove, Westbourne Park and Royal Oak.

Saturday 23, Sunday 24 and Bank Holiday Monday 25 May, suspended between Hammersmith and Edgware Road. A rail replacement bus service operates.

Service A: between Hammersmith and Paddington, calling at Goldhawk Road, Shepherds Bush Central, Latimer Road, Ladbroke Road, Westbourne Park and Royal Oak.

Jubilee

Part closure

Sunday 24 May, suspended between North Greenwich and Stratford. A rail replacement bus service operates.

Service F: between North Greenwich and Stratford, calling at Canning Town and West Ham.

See how we are transforming the Tube

Metropolitan

Part closure

Saturday 23, Sunday 24 and Bank Holiday Monday 25 May, suspended between Northwood and Rickmansworth and Northwood and Watford. Two rail replacement bus services operate.

Service A: between Northwood and Watford, calling at Rickmansworth and Croxley.

Service B: between Northwood and Moor Park.

NB. Chiltern Railways is also suspended between Marylebone and Amersham.

See how we are transforming the Tube

Northern

Part closure

Saturday 23, Sunday 24 and Bank Holiday Monday 25 May, suspended between Finchley Central and High Barnet. Rail replacement bus service operates.

Service A: between High Barnet and Finchley Central, calling at Totteridge & Whetstone, Woodside Park and West Finchley.

Minor delays are occurring on the Uxbridge branch due to an earlier signal failure at Ealing Common.

Planned closure

Monday - Friday 0615 - 2148. Saturday 0800 - 1830. Closed Sunday and Public Holidays.

Tube stations

Closed stations

Goodge Street

Saturday 23 until Bank Holiday Monday 25 May, inclusive, closed.

Tottenham Court Road and Warren Street are the nearest alternative stations.

Journey times may be increased by up to 15 minutes.

See how we are transforming the Tube

Hatton Cross

Saturday 23, Sunday 24 May, and Bank Holiday Monday 25 May, closed.

See how we are transforming the Tube

Holloway Road

On Sunday 24 May, HOLLOWAY ROAD STATION is exit only from approximately 1330. All WESTBOUND trains (towards Central London) will stop and customers will be able to exit the station unless overcrowding occurs. From approximately 1400, no EASTBOUND trains (from Central London) will stop at the station. At around 1500 the station will fully reopen for entry and exit. From 1630 until crowds have sufficiently dispersed, the station will be exit only, but all westbound and eastbound trains will stop.

See how we are transforming the Tube

Wood Green Station

Saturday 23, Sunday 24 and Bank Holiday Monday 25 May, closed.

See how we are transforming the Tube

Station maintenance

Blackfriars

Until late 2011, Network Rail is carrying out major improvements to the Underground station as part of the Thameslink Upgrade programme. District and Circle line trains will not stop at the station during this time.

See how we are transforming the Tube

Camden Town

At weekends there is no down escalator service between 1000 and 1300, and between 1300 and 1700 (1730 Sunday) the station is exit and interchange only. Customers unable to walk down the 96 steps or enter the station should use Chalk Farm (a short walk from Camden Market) or Mornington Crescent.

See how we are transforming the Tube

No step free access to the westbound platform due to a faulty lift.

FULHAM BROADWAY:No step free access to the westbound platform due to a faulty lift.

Marble Arch

See how we are transforming the Tube

Monument

Please avoid using Monument Station to interchange with services from Bank. Until summer 2009 interchange between District and Circle line services at Monument and all services from Bank station is only available at street level due to escalator refurbishment works. As an alternative use nearby Mansion House or Cannon Street stations which are a short walk from Bank. Maps of the area are available at both stations. Local bus services 21 43 133 and 141 also operate between London Bridge and Moorgate stations calling at Bank and Monument.

Interchange at the station may involve walking routes at street level.  Oyster Pay-As-You-Go users need to interchange within 30 minutes to avoid being charged twice.

Click to find out more
